channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gaza's Catholics mourn Pope Francis. 'He used to call us at 7 p.m. every night'
item.description: Pope Francis called to check in on a Christian congregation in Gaza sheltering at their church almost every night since the Gaza war began. "Today we ...

item.title: '60 Minutes' chief resigns, saying show's independence was compromised
item.description: The longtime head of CBS' 60 Minutes resigned Tuesday, as the network's parent company grapples with President Trump's lawsuit over an interview the s...

item.title: The global economy will be hit hard by Trump's tariffs, IMF warns
item.description: The International Monetary Fund slashed its growth forecasts for the global economy to 2.8% as President Trump's tariffs risk sparking a trade war.

item.title: Trump fires more immigration judges even as he aims to increase deportations
item.description: Getting rid of judges adds to criticism of the Trump administration for not giving migrants or noncitizens enough due process before they're deported.

item.title: Harvard professor offers a grim assessment of American democracy under Trump
item.description: Steven Levitsky studies how healthy democracies can slip into authoritarianism. He says the Trump administration has already done grave damage: "We ar...

item.title: Direct File, which saves taxpayers money, may be shut down. Here's why.
item.description: Amid reports the IRS may end its free Direct File program, more than 170 lawmakers are demanding it remains open.

item.title: More than 20 killed after gunmen open fire on tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir
item.description: The region's chief minister said the attack was "much larger than anything we've seen directed at civilians in recent years".

item.title: Some GOP states are targeting driverâ€™s licenses issued to immigrants illegally in the US
4/22: CBS Morning News
item.description: Pope Francis' funeral is scheduled for Saturday at St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican announced; President Trump stands by Defense Secretary Pete Hegse...

item.title: We're orphans now, say Gaza Catholics the Pope called daily
item.description: Pope Francis had a close relationship with Gaza's tiny Christian community and used his last address to call for a ceasefire.

item.title: Ghana president suspends chief justice in unprecedented move
item.description: An investigation has been launched into allegations against Gertrude Torkornoo, Ghana's third female chief justice.

item.title: Man convicted of murdering mother whose daughter remains missing
item.description: A Connecticut jury on Tuesday convicted Jose Morales, 48, of murder and evidence tampering in the 2019 killing of Christine Holloway.

item.title: Main opposition leader removed from Ivory Coast electoral list
item.description: A court argued Tidjane Thiam forfeited his Ivorian nationality when he became a French citizen in 1987.

item.title: Anti-Defamation League says anger at Israel is now the driving force behind antisemitism in the US
item.description: The Anti-Defamation League says the number of antisemitic incidents in the United States reached a record high last year.

item.title: Watch Live: Witnesses take stand in Karen Read trial
item.description: Watch live as Karen Read's second trial starts today with opening statements in the Massachusetts murder case.

item.title: Apr 22: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: Catholics around the world remember Pope Francis; White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt suggests Federal Reserve is not independent.

item.title: Large explosions at Russian ammunition depot east of Moscow
item.description: Russian military authorities say the blast in a warehouse is due to a fire.

item.title: 60,000 Americans to lose their rental assistance and risk eviction unless Congress acts
